newsitem.title: USA: N.J. candidates say Whitman's tax cuts a mistake.
newsitem.headline: N.J. candidates say Whitman's tax cuts a mistake.

text.p: The three rivals in New Jersey's Democratic primary for governor held their first televised debate Wednesday night, agreeing that Gov. Christine Whitman's tax cuts were fiscally unwise.
Rep., Rob Andrews of Haddon Heights, state Sen. James McGreevey of Middlesex County, and former Morris County prosecutor Michael Murphy also agreed that the state needs to do more on education.
But they disagreed on whether the Garden State should help finance a controversial $330 million tunnel project in Atlantic City.
Andrews backed it, while McGreevey said the money should have been shared statewide. Murphy said it should not be built at all.
All three candidates said they would take the full $135,000 salary the governor is entitled to, unlike the last two governors who took only $85,000.
